subject: Re: [junit] Per test fixture?
msgSnippet: You are correct... You might also try using the latest JUnit, and annotations, instead of naming tests with the prefix test. Hope I helped, Big Mike ...
messageBody:
You are correct...

You might also try using the latest JUnit, and annotations, instead of
naming tests with the prefix test.

Hope I helped,

Big Mike

On Mon, Mar 8, 2010 at 6:07 AM, David Bala≈æic <xerces9@...> wrote:

>
>
> Hi!
>
> What is the recommended way to setup test data for one test method
> only? Just do it at the beginning of the test method?
>
> Example:
>
> public void setUp()
> {
> // common setup
> }
>
> public void testOne()
> {
> setUpForTest1(); // stuff only needed for this test
>
> // do the testing 1....
> }
>
> public void testTwo()
> {
> setUpForTest2();
>
> // do the testing 2....
> }
>
> Or is there special support from JUnit for this?
>
> Regards,
> David
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
